control involve query against the following resources the first one that i would like to
highlight is elastic block store or ebs volume this control checks whether the elastic
block stores snapshots are not public the control fail if the ebay snapshots
are restorable by anyone ebay snapshots are used to backup the
data on your ebs volume 2 and 2r2 and s3 bucket at a specific point in time
the other one is vpc default security group this control checks the default security
group of a vpc does not allow any inbound or outbound traffic
we do not recommend using the default security group because the default security groups cannot be deleted we
should change the default security group to restrict inborn and outbound traffic
this prevents unintended traffic if the default security group is accidentally
configured to any of your resources such as your ec2 instance or your rds
the third one that i would like to highlight is auto scaling this control checks auto scaling groups
that are associated with load balancer if they are using elastic load balancing health checks or not
this ensures that group can determine instance health based on an additional
test provided by load balancer now coming to the last one the cloud
trail this control checks that there is at least one multi-lead region cloudtrail
aws cloudtrail records api calls for all your accounts and deliver log files to
you the recorded information from cloudtrail includes identity of the api caller time
of the api call source ip address of the api caller and many other important factors

aggregation finding works during cross region aggregation new and
updated findings are replicated from the linked region to the aggregation region
update to the findings that occur in the aggregation region are replicated back to the linked region where the findings
originated one important point to note here is that the security hub only replicates
findings from the regions where the security hub is already enabled security hub is not enabled
automatically based on the finding aggregation configuration that you have provided
the other important point here is that you can view the configuration from any region however you can only update the

how does this all happens in background so once you have identified a finding
that is of your interest or that you want to take an action on you can select
it and then you have to send it as an action out of the security hub
once you have taken this action on this finding it is emitted as a cloud watch event and then inside the cloudwatch
event console you have rules these rules are looking for the custom action id that have triggered this event
when the cloud watch finds a match then the cloud watch rule is triggered and those findings are sent to the target as
defined in the rule the target is usually a lambda function or a step function and that does some
additional processing on the data and ultimately send it to its final destination which might be something
like a slab web hook or it could be a full blown remediation package that aws
error provides this gives our customer a lot of flexibility to define the actions they
want and that are appropriate for their workload requirement
